blog.name: my-ddaeng-world
blog.title: 𝓔·𝐩𝐢𝐟𝐚𝐧𝐢𝐚
blog.description:
·𝐁𝐓𝐒 𝐅𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐏𝐡𝐨𝐭𝐨𝐬 & 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐎𝐓𝟕·
“-𝒕𝒐 𝒍𝒊𝒗𝒆 𝒘𝒊𝒕𝒉 𝒂 𝒃𝒆𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓 𝒉𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕, 𝒂 𝒉𝒂𝒑𝒑𝒊𝒆𝒓 𝒉𝒆𝒂𝒓𝒕, 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝒖𝒍𝒕𝒊𝒎𝒂𝒕𝒆𝒍𝒚, 𝒊𝒔 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒔𝒕𝒂𝒓𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒑𝒐𝒊𝒏𝒕 𝒐𝒇 𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒓𝒚𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒏𝒈” ⁽ᴿᴹ ᴸᵒᵍ ²⁰¹⁸⁾
✿ ʟ-αяму 𝟐𝟑 · 𝐅

summary: A Secret Just Between Us Two
title: A Secret Just Between Us Two
body:
by volatile_sunshine


Kiss me on the lips
This is a secret just between the two of us
I am addicted to the prison that is you
I cannot worship
Anyone else besides you
- Blood, Sweat and Tears, BTS
―༻❁༺―

title: When It's All Over
body:
by gwoongi

Born with a purpose, Jeon Jeongguk is given the task of delivering the Elder Wand to Lord Voldemort in preparation for his return back to England, to defeat Harry Potter and repair his tarnished and damaged reputation. The only trouble is that the Elder Wand belongs to the most powerful family in Korea, and in the hands of their newest heir, Park Jimin.

Or, quite simply:

Jeon Jeongguk does a job for the Dark Lord.

Words: 64, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of When It’s All Over (Death Eater AU)

  • Fandoms: 방탄소년단 | Bangtan Boys | BTS, LOONA (Korea Band)
  • Rating: Mature
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Jeon Jungkook, Park Jimin (BTS), Jung Hoseok | J-Hope, Kim Taehyung | V, Min Yoongi | Suga, Kim Namjoon | RM, Kim Seokjin | Jin, LOONA Ensemble, NCT Ensemble, Jeon Jungkook’s Parents
  • Relationships: Jeon Jungkook/Park Jimin, Jeon Heejin/Jo Haseul, Ha Sooyoung | Yves/Kim Jiwoo | Chuu
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Hogwarts, Death Eaters, Second War with Voldemort, Magic, Supernatural Elements, Hufflepuff Park Jimin, Hufflepuff Jeon Jungkook, Hufflepuff Kim Taehyung | V, Slytherin Min Yoongi | Suga, Gryffindor Hoseok, Gryffindor Seokjin, Ravenclaw Namjoon, Dubious Consent, Blood and Gore, Sexual Tension, Explicit Sexual Content, Slow Burn, Forbidden Love


source http://archiveofourown.org/works/16938525

summary: Bangtan 25 Days of Christmas Special: Day #10
title: Bangtan 25 Days of Christmas Special: Day #10
body:
Pairing: Namjoon X Reader

Warning: Fluff, fluff, fluff

Summary: As a school project, Namjoon and Y/N must become pen pals with someone in their class. They just don’t know who they are writing to.

Author’s Note: Bruh we’re kids now. Can’t be a Christmas special without kids.

   “Okay, children, gather around.” Mr. Kim playfully said.

   “Mr. Kim we are not children.” A boy, Jimin, retorted. “We are 10 and 11 years old. We are big boys and girls.” As he spoke the last part, his voice cracked. The other kids started to laugh as Jimin hid his face in his hands.

   “Oh, yeah. You’re all grown up.” Mr. Kim said, smiling at his little pupil. “Today we’re going to start a new project!” The class erupted in joyful cheers. Seokjin cheered along with his students. He continued to explain the project once everything had calmed down. “Our project is I’m going to assign you a pen pal.”

   “What’s a pen pal?” A kid named Hoseok asked.

   “A pen pal is someone who you write letters to.” Another boy, Namjoon, answered. His eyes sparkled like the stars he constantly looked up to. You softly smiled before looking away, a light blush dusting your cheeks.

   “Very good, Namjoon!” Mr. Kim beamed with delight. “You are correct!”

   “But aren’t pen pals supposed to be anonymous?” A girl asked this time. Her name was Lisa. “How are we supposed to write to the person if we know who it is?”

   “Now that’s the thing, Lisa. You all don’t know who you’re writing to.” The class gasped, eyes widened with curiosity. “Only I, the amazingly awesome and dashing Mr. Kim knows who you are writing to.”

   He reached into his deck and pulled out a red solo cup with popsicle sticks poking out. “These popsicle sticks have a number written on it. Whatever one you pick, you’ll show me your number and I’ll write it down.” He explained. The next time he spoke, Mr. Kim dropped his voice to an almost growl. “But you and I are the only ones who know what number you have. Under no circumstances are you supposed to tell others what number you have. This is supposed to be anonymous and the project will only work if you keep your number a secret. Got it?” As he talked, Mr. Kim met eyes with every single one of his students. He met eyes again with some of the troublesome kids like Taehyung and BamBam.

   The process of picking a popsicle went in alphabetical order of last names.  You did a little hop as you approached Mr. Kim’s desk. He grinned happily at you. “Hello, Y/N.” He greeted. “Reach in and pick one. Afterward, show me what you got.”

   He leaned over your shoulder to see which one you picked. Beside your name, he wrote down a 13. When he turned back to look at you, your face displayed disappointment. His merry smile instantly fell.

   “Y/N?” He asked in a tender voice. “Is there something wrong?”

   “No, not exactly.” You mumbled. “Isn’t 13 an unlucky number?”

   Seokjin instantly shook his head. “It could be, but to me, it is one of the luckiest numbers out there.”

   Your face beamed when you met his eyes. “Really?”

    “Yes, Y/N.” You smiled and nodded your head, satisfied with your picking and quickly went back to your desk.

   Soon, it was time to assign pen pals. Mr. Kim stood at the front of the room and called out the paired numbers. “Next is number 13 with 22!” He announced. You stiffened when he called out your number, but you didn’t dare to look around to see if anyone else had a similar reaction to you.  

   Namjoon indeed had a similar reaction to you, but you didn’t see and he didn’t see yours.

   “The first number called out in the pair will write the first letter. As they write, the other numbers will go over to Mr. Jeon’s room and watch a movie with his kids.” Mr. Kim said. “Alright, everyone, get to work. Kids going to watch the movie please line up at the door.”

   The entire thing should’ve been easy, but your little mind was reeling. You had never done something like this before and you couldn’t figure out what to say.

   After an hour and a half, the only thing you had written down was a simple Hi.
The next day in class, the two groups switched to allow the other kids to respond to their pen pals. You grinned as you opened your pen pal’s response.

   Hi

   And that one, little and innocent word, started a blissful and everlasting friendship between you two.

   Unlike all the other kids in your class, you and Namjoon kept writing to each other. Somehow, it’s still a mystery to you and everyone else, you two managed to keep your identities a mystery. Mr. Kim even went as far as to tell you both that there we other partners in your class who were still writing. After fifteen years, you two were still writing happily to the other for a school project in 5th grade.


        Dear 13,

          Wow, we’ve been writing to each other for about fifteen years now. Crazy, right? How have you been? Is everything alright at work? I sure hope so.  A lot lately I’ve found myself thinking about you and wondering just who you are. If you’re up for it, I’ll love to meet up and finally find out who you are.

        Just tell me where and when, and I’ll be there.
                                                 Sincerely,
                                                     Your Number 22


   Your heart beats wildly in your chest as you read over the letter. You couldn’t stop rereading it, making sure it was real and it said what it said. It wouldn’t be the first time that you misread something in the letters Number 22 sent you.

   You folded the letter neatly back into its envelope and placed it into a box along with the others. Some may call it odd, but ever since you two started exchanging letters, you’ve kept every single one he sent to you. These letters were apart of your life and held most of the contents of your childhood. No one letter was the same; Each one of those letters was a memory special in their own way. You wanted to preserve them and maybe one day show them to your children and tell them about the mystery man you’ve unconsciously fallen in love with.

   Picking up a pen and a piece of paper, you began to compose your response.

   A couple of days later, Namjoon was ecstatic to find a familiar velvet sealed envelope in his mailbox. He ripped through the packaging to read the letter you sent. Normally he was very careful in opening the letters, but ever since he mailed his letter last week, he’s been anxiously awaiting your response, scared out of his mind of rejection.

   Namjoon sucked in a breath before starting to read your letter:


         December 10th, Coffee shop at the corner of Bangtan Avenue, 12 o’clock sharp.

                                                                                                            Love,                                                                                                                 13

   You were all kinds of nervous as you sat at a table in Daesang’s Coffee Shop. Wanting to be so plainly obvious, you wore a headband with a big 13 on it. Yeah, you looked ridiculous but you could care less what others thought. You were meeting your mysterious pen pal and crush after fifteen years of correspondence. The air was tense and you wanted to add some fun to it to try to relieve some of the stress.

   You heard a deep chuckle come from beside you. Slowly, you lifted your head and faced the man standing there. You sharply inhaled as you met his intense but loving gaze.

   “Hello, Y/N.” Namjoon greeted, his dimples revealing themselves.

   “Hello, Namjoon.” You smiled. “I haven’t seen you since high school.” You giggled nervously, an old habit of yours. Namjoon felt his heart melt at the sound.

   “May I sit?” He gestured to the seat across from you.

   “Yes, please.” You responded. You two sat there in that coffee shop for hours, talking and reminiscing on old times back in school. Sitting there talking, you both found you had more in common than either of you realized.

   All too soon, it came time to bid your goodbyes. You two exchanged phone numbers and had promised to meet up again soon after the holidays. “Thank you, Namjoon. I had an amazing time.” You said before making your way to your care. Before you could take two steps, a hand grabbed onto yours. You turned back around, an eyebrow raised in question.

   “Can I kiss you?” Namjoon’s voice was barely above a whisper as he asked the question. You didn’t need to speak, only nodding your head in permission. He gently cupped your face in his hand and captured your lips with his own.

      5 years later….

   Mr. Kim Seokjin was finishing up some papers when there was a knock on his door. “Come in,” He said without looking up. He heard heavy footsteps enter the room. The person stood in quiet as Seokjin finished grading the paper.

   Seokjin was not expecting to see a dimple-grinned Kim Namjoon standing in the doorway of his classroom when he looked up. Namjoon watched as Seokjin’s entire face lit up and he rose from his chair.

   “Namjoon,” He greeted as he ran over to shake his old pupil’s gloved hand. “Long time so see.”

   “Mr. Kim.” Namjoon greeted. “Have you been well?”

   “I’ve been fine, thanks.” Seokjin didn’t miss the ring on his left hand. He grinned knowingly. “Who’s the lucky lady?”

   Namjoon smiled widely before calling out, “Honey!” Seokjin turned towards the door, waiting to see the lucky bride of his favorite student. Needless to say, he was not expecting to see you waddle into the room with a swollen abdomen, but his wild grin never faltered.

   “Y/N!” He greeted. “You two are married?”

   You nodded your head, “Yes we are.”

   “And pregnant,” Namjoon added with a chuckle.

   “Congratulations, both of you,” Seokjin said. “Wow. I always thought you two could get together, but I would’ve never guessed I’ll be right!” Y’all laughed.

   “That’s actually why we’re here,” Namjoon said, a shy blush forming on his cheeks.

   Seokjin tilted his head to the side, confused. You answered his silent question. “If it weren’t for you pairing us up in that pen pal project than we probably would’ve never gotten together.

   His eyes widened in shock. “A..are you serious?” You two nodded your heads in confirmation.  “Oh my gosh.” He whispered out.

   “That’s why we’re naming our son after you, Kim Seokjin.” you continued. “That way you’re always apart of our lives. No matter what.”

         December 10th, Coffee shop at the corner of Bangtan Avenue, 12 o’clock sharp.

   You were all kinds of nervous as you sat at a table in Daesang’s Coffee Shop. Wanting to be so plainly obvious, you wore a headband with a big 13 on it. Yeah, you looked ridiculous but you could care less what others thought. You were meeting your mysterious pen pal and crush after fifteen years of correspondence. The air was tense and you wanted to add some fun to it to try to relieve some of the stress.

   You heard a deep chuckle come from beside you. Slowly, you lifted your head and faced the man standing there. You sharply inhaled as you met his intense but loving gaze.

   “Hello, Y/N.” Namjoon greeted, his dimples revealing themselves.

   “Hello, Namjoon.” You smiled. “I haven’t seen you since high school.” You giggled nervously, an old habit of yours. Namjoon felt his heart melt at the sound.

   “May I sit?” He gestured to the seat across from you.

   “Yes, please.” You responded. You two sat there in that coffee shop for hours, talking and reminiscing on old times back in school. Sitting there talking, you both found you had more in common than either of you realized.

   All too soon, it came time to bid your goodbyes. You two exchanged phone numbers and had promised to meet up again soon after the holidays. “Thank you, Namjoon. I had an amazing time.” You said before making your way to your care. Before you could take two steps, a hand grabbed onto yours. You turned back around, an eyebrow raised in question.

   “Can I kiss you?” Namjoon’s voice was barely above a whisper as he asked the question. You didn’t need to speak, only nodding your head in permission. He gently cupped your face in his hand and captured your lips with his own.

      5 years later….

   Mr. Kim Seokjin was finishing up some papers when there was a knock on his door. “Come in,” He said without looking up. He heard heavy footsteps enter the room. The person stood in quiet as Seokjin finished grading the paper.

   Seokjin was not expecting to see a dimple-grinned Kim Namjoon standing in the doorway of his classroom when he looked up. Namjoon watched as Seokjin’s entire face lit up and he rose from his chair.

   “Namjoon,” He greeted as he ran over to shake his old pupil’s gloved hand. “Long time so see.”

   “Mr. Kim.” Namjoon greeted. “Have you been well?”

   “I’ve been fine, thanks.” Seokjin didn’t miss the ring on his left hand. He grinned knowingly. “Who’s the lucky lady?”

   Namjoon smiled widely before calling out, “Honey!” Seokjin turned towards the door, waiting to see the lucky bride of his favorite student. Needless to say, he was not expecting to see you waddle into the room with a swollen abdomen, but his wild grin never faltered.

   “Y/N!” He greeted. “You two are married?”

   You nodded your head, “Yes we are.”

   “And pregnant,” Namjoon added with a chuckle.

   “Congratulations, both of you,” Seokjin said. “Wow. I always thought you two could get together, but I would’ve never guessed I’ll be right!” Y’all laughed.

   “That’s actually why we’re here,” Namjoon said, a shy blush forming on his cheeks.

   Seokjin tilted his head to the side, confused. You answered his silent question. “If it weren’t for you pairing us up in that pen pal project than we probably would’ve never gotten together.

   His eyes widened in shock. “A..are you serious?” You two nodded your heads in confirmation.  “Oh my gosh.” He whispered out.

   “That’s why we’re naming our son after you, Kim Seokjin.” you continued. “That way you’re always apart of our lives. No matter what.”
trail.content:
Pairing: Namjoon X Reader

Warning: Fluff, fluff, fluff

Summary: As a school project, Namjoon and Y/N must become pen pals with someone in their class. They just don’t know who they are writing to.

Author’s Note: Bruh we’re kids now. Can’t be a Christmas special without kids.

   “Okay, children, gather around.” Mr. Kim playfully said.

   “Mr. Kim we are not children.” A boy, Jimin, retorted. “We are 10 and 11 years old. We are big boys and girls.” As he spoke the last part, his voice cracked. The other kids started to laugh as Jimin hid his face in his hands.

   “Oh, yeah. You’re all grown up.” Mr. Kim said, smiling at his little pupil. “Today we’re going to start a new project!” The class erupted in joyful cheers. Seokjin cheered along with his students. He continued to explain the project once everything had calmed down. “Our project is I’m going to assign you a pen pal.”

   “What’s a pen pal?” A kid named Hoseok asked.

   “A pen pal is someone who you write letters to.” Another boy, Namjoon, answered. His eyes sparkled like the stars he constantly looked up to. You softly smiled before looking away, a light blush dusting your cheeks.

   “Very good, Namjoon!” Mr. Kim beamed with delight. “You are correct!”

   “But aren’t pen pals supposed to be anonymous?” A girl asked this time. Her name was Lisa. “How are we supposed to write to the person if we know who it is?”

   “Now that’s the thing, Lisa. You all don’t know who you’re writing to.” The class gasped, eyes widened with curiosity. “Only I, the amazingly awesome and dashing Mr. Kim knows who you are writing to.”

   He reached into his deck and pulled out a red solo cup with popsicle sticks poking out. “These popsicle sticks have a number written on it. Whatever one you pick, you’ll show me your number and I’ll write it down.” He explained. The next time he spoke, Mr. Kim dropped his voice to an almost growl. “But you and I are the only ones who know what number you have. Under no circumstances are you supposed to tell others what number you have. This is supposed to be anonymous and the project will only work if you keep your number a secret. Got it?” As he talked, Mr. Kim met eyes with every single one of his students. He met eyes again with some of the troublesome kids like Taehyung and BamBam.

   The process of picking a popsicle went in alphabetical order of last names.  You did a little hop as you approached Mr. Kim’s desk. He grinned happily at you. “Hello, Y/N.” He greeted. “Reach in and pick one. Afterward, show me what you got.”

   He leaned over your shoulder to see which one you picked. Beside your name, he wrote down a 13. When he turned back to look at you, your face displayed disappointment. His merry smile instantly fell.

   “Y/N?” He asked in a tender voice. “Is there something wrong?”

   “No, not exactly.” You mumbled. “Isn’t 13 an unlucky number?”

   Seokjin instantly shook his head. “It could be, but to me, it is one of the luckiest numbers out there.”

   Your face beamed when you met his eyes. “Really?”

    “Yes, Y/N.” You smiled and nodded your head, satisfied with your picking and quickly went back to your desk.

   Soon, it was time to assign pen pals. Mr. Kim stood at the front of the room and called out the paired numbers. “Next is number 13 with 22!” He announced. You stiffened when he called out your number, but you didn’t dare to look around to see if anyone else had a similar reaction to you.  

   Namjoon indeed had a similar reaction to you, but you didn’t see and he didn’t see yours.

   “The first number called out in the pair will write the first letter. As they write, the other numbers will go over to Mr. Jeon’s room and watch a movie with his kids.” Mr. Kim said. “Alright, everyone, get to work. Kids going to watch the movie please line up at the door.”

   The entire thing should’ve been easy, but your little mind was reeling. You had never done something like this before and you couldn’t figure out what to say.

   After an hour and a half, the only thing you had written down was a simple Hi.
The next day in class, the two groups switched to allow the other kids to respond to their pen pals. You grinned as you opened your pen pal’s response.

   Hi

   And that one, little and innocent word, started a blissful and everlasting friendship between you two.

   Unlike all the other kids in your class, you and Namjoon kept writing to each other. Somehow, it’s still a mystery to you and everyone else, you two managed to keep your identities a mystery. Mr. Kim even went as far as to tell you both that there we other partners in your class who were still writing. After fifteen years, you two were still writing happily to the other for a school project in 5th grade.


        Dear 13,

          Wow, we’ve been writing to each other for about fifteen years now. Crazy, right? How have you been? Is everything alright at work? I sure hope so.  A lot lately I’ve found myself thinking about you and wondering just who you are. If you’re up for it, I’ll love to meet up and finally find out who you are.

        Just tell me where and when, and I’ll be there.
                                                 Sincerely,
                                                     Your Number 22


   Your heart beats wildly in your chest as you read over the letter. You couldn’t stop rereading it, making sure it was real and it said what it said. It wouldn’t be the first time that you misread something in the letters Number 22 sent you.

   You folded the letter neatly back into its envelope and placed it into a box along with the others. Some may call it odd, but ever since you two started exchanging letters, you’ve kept every single one he sent to you. These letters were apart of your life and held most of the contents of your childhood. No one letter was the same; Each one of those letters was a memory special in their own way. You wanted to preserve them and maybe one day show them to your children and tell them about the mystery man you’ve unconsciously fallen in love with.

   Picking up a pen and a piece of paper, you began to compose your response.

   A couple of days later, Namjoon was ecstatic to find a familiar velvet sealed envelope in his mailbox. He ripped through the packaging to read the letter you sent. Normally he was very careful in opening the letters, but ever since he mailed his letter last week, he’s been anxiously awaiting your response, scared out of his mind of rejection.

   Namjoon sucked in a breath before starting to read your letter:


         December 10th, Coffee shop at the corner of Bangtan Avenue, 12 o’clock sharp.

                                                                                                            Love,                                                                                                                 13

   You were all kinds of nervous as you sat at a table in Daesang’s Coffee Shop. Wanting to be so plainly obvious, you wore a headband with a big 13 on it. Yeah, you looked ridiculous but you could care less what others thought. You were meeting your mysterious pen pal and crush after fifteen years of correspondence. The air was tense and you wanted to add some fun to it to try to relieve some of the stress.

   You heard a deep chuckle come from beside you. Slowly, you lifted your head and faced the man standing there. You sharply inhaled as you met his intense but loving gaze.

   “Hello, Y/N.” Namjoon greeted, his dimples revealing themselves.

   “Hello, Namjoon.” You smiled. “I haven’t seen you since high school.” You giggled nervously, an old habit of yours. Namjoon felt his heart melt at the sound.

   “May I sit?” He gestured to the seat across from you.

   “Yes, please.” You responded. You two sat there in that coffee shop for hours, talking and reminiscing on old times back in school. Sitting there talking, you both found you had more in common than either of you realized.

   All too soon, it came time to bid your goodbyes. You two exchanged phone numbers and had promised to meet up again soon after the holidays. “Thank you, Namjoon. I had an amazing time.” You said before making your way to your care. Before you could take two steps, a hand grabbed onto yours. You turned back around, an eyebrow raised in question.

   “Can I kiss you?” Namjoon’s voice was barely above a whisper as he asked the question. You didn’t need to speak, only nodding your head in permission. He gently cupped your face in his hand and captured your lips with his own.

      5 years later….

   Mr. Kim Seokjin was finishing up some papers when there was a knock on his door. “Come in,” He said without looking up. He heard heavy footsteps enter the room. The person stood in quiet as Seokjin finished grading the paper.

   Seokjin was not expecting to see a dimple-grinned Kim Namjoon standing in the doorway of his classroom when he looked up. Namjoon watched as Seokjin’s entire face lit up and he rose from his chair.

   “Namjoon,” He greeted as he ran over to shake his old pupil’s gloved hand. “Long time so see.”

   “Mr. Kim.” Namjoon greeted. “Have you been well?”

   “I’ve been fine, thanks.” Seokjin didn’t miss the ring on his left hand. He grinned knowingly. “Who’s the lucky lady?”

   Namjoon smiled widely before calling out, “Honey!” Seokjin turned towards the door, waiting to see the lucky bride of his favorite student. Needless to say, he was not expecting to see you waddle into the room with a swollen abdomen, but his wild grin never faltered.

   “Y/N!” He greeted. “You two are married?”

   You nodded your head, “Yes we are.”

   “And pregnant,” Namjoon added with a chuckle.

   “Congratulations, both of you,” Seokjin said. “Wow. I always thought you two could get together, but I would’ve never guessed I’ll be right!” Y’all laughed.

   “That’s actually why we’re here,” Namjoon said, a shy blush forming on his cheeks.

   Seokjin tilted his head to the side, confused. You answered his silent question. “If it weren’t for you pairing us up in that pen pal project than we probably would’ve never gotten together.

   His eyes widened in shock. “A..are you serious?” You two nodded your heads in confirmation.  “Oh my gosh.” He whispered out.

   “That’s why we’re naming our son after you, Kim Seokjin.” you continued. “That way you’re always apart of our lives. No matter what.”
